Based on your preferences for a world war ii movie, I would highly recommend watching the classic and iconic film "The Shawshank Redemption" (1994).
"The Shawshank Redemption" is a powerful, emotional, and uplifting story about hope, friendship, and redemption.
Set in the 19th century, the film follows the life of Andy Dufresne, played by Tim Robbins, who is sentenced to two consecutive terms at Shawshank State Penitentiary, run by Captain Red, played by Morgan Freeman.
Through their journey together, Andy and Red develop a deep bond and friendship, which gives them hope and strength even in the darkest and most challenging of circumstances.
Throughout the film, we see Andy and Red struggle against the harsh and oppressive conditions and systems that they face at Shawshank State Penitentiary, run by Captain Red.
Despite the constant and overwhelming pressure and adversity that they face at Shawshank State Penitentiary, run by Captain Red, Andy and Red remain steadfast in their commitment to truth, justice, and righteousness, even in the face of overwhelming adversity and pressure.
In the end, despite facing many challenges and obstacles along the way, Andy and Red ultimately triumph over adversity and achieve their goals and dreams.
Through the power of friendship, hope, and redemption, "The Shawshank Redemption" is a truly exceptional and powerful film that is sure to delight audiences for years to come.

Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "Madame Bovary" (1856) because it has similar themes of love and desire, as well as a dark past and even darker secret.

On the other hand, if the user is more interested in martial arts, then "The Karate Kid" (1984) might be a better choice. This movie revolves around a young boy named Daniel who moves from New Jersey to Los Angeles with his family. At his new school, Daniel is bullied by a group of bullies known as the Cobra Kai dojos. One day, Daniel's best friend and mentor, Mr. Miyagi, saves him from being bullied by the Cobra Kai dojos. Mr. Miyagi teaches Daniel several advanced techniques of martial arts known as the Karate Kid style techniques such as punch, kick, block, etc. Mr. Miyagi also helps Daniel to find his true identity and inner strength through various experiences. Over time, Daniel manages to defeat the Cobra Kai dojos by using the advanced techniques he learned from Mr. Miyagi. After defeating the Cobra Kai dojos, Daniel decides to continue learning from Mr. Miyagi and continue practicing the advanced techniques he learned from Mr. Miyagi in order to continue improving his martial arts skills.
